Thank you for putting that out there (you tube).=A0 This is the same method=
 we are using in a current case and it is provingto be effective.=A0 I am f=
inding that I am getting a combination of radio sentence fragments that for=
m sentences as well as traditional EVP while using this method.=A0 There ar=
e moments when I am utterly amazed at the information I am receiving.=A0 We=
 then take this information and attempt to locate the vitims remains.
In my=
 current case we are attempting to locate deceased murder victims from the =
late eighties and early nineties.=A0 This is at the request of the 'offende=
rs' family in order to give the victims family peace and allow them to lay =
their loved ones to rest.=A0 I will share some of my files on esnips.=A0 I =
will include a link after I upload them for anyone who is interested!=A0 
=
=A0
Suzanne

--- On Sat, 12/6/08, Michael E <f1cracker75@...> wrote:
=

From: Michael E <f1cracker75@...>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] EVP-Radio Crime=
 Recording Video
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Saturday, December 6, 20=
08, 6:52 PM






Hi everyone, I have recorded a video of my EVP-Radio Crim=
e recording 
process, where I get leads from deceased victims and hand over=
 to law 
enforcement or missing person advocates to run the leads.

http://=
uk.youtube. com/watch? v=3DWhGKXBp6Lg0

I went out to Mike Colletta's site =
to see if there was any guidance, 
but none on how to sync up my voice in t=
he video.

I used a web cam to do the recording.

Does anyone know how to d=
o this?

Mike Edwards

Content-Type: text/html; charset=us-ascii

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" ><tr><td valign="top" style="font: inherit;"><DIV>Thank you for putting that out there (you tube).  This is the same method we are using in a current case and it is provingto be effective.  I am finding that I am getting a combination of radio sentence fragments that form sentences as well as traditional EVP while using this method.  There are moments when I am utterly amazed at the information I am receiving.  We then take this information and attempt to locate the vitims remains.</DIV>
<DIV>In my current case we are attempting to locate deceased murder victims from the late eighties and early nineties.  This is at the request of the 'offenders' family in order to give the victims family peace and allow them to lay their loved ones to rest.  I will share some of my files on esnips.  I will include a link after I upload them for anyone who is interested!  </DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Suzanne<BR><BR>--- On <B>Sat, 12/6/08, Michael E <I><f1cracker75@...></I></B> wrote:<BR></DIV>
<BLOCKQUOTE style="PADDING-LEFT: 5px; MARGIN-LEFT: 5px; BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid">From: Michael E <f1cracker75@...><BR>Subject: [EVP-ITC] EVP-Radio Crime Recording Video<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<BR>Date: Saturday, December 6, 2008, 6:52 PM<BR><BR>
<DIV id=yiv843712198>
<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<DIV>Hi everyone, I have recorded a video of my EVP-Radio Crime recording <BR>process, where I get leads from deceased victims and hand over to law <BR>enforcement or missing person advocates to run the leads.<BR><BR><A href="http://uk.youtube.com/watch?v=WhGKXBp6Lg0" target=_blank rel=nofollow>http://uk.youtube. com/watch? v=WhGKXBp6Lg0</A><BR><BR>I went out to Mike Colletta's site to see if there was any guidance, <BR>but none on how to sync up my voice in the video.<BR><BR>I used a web cam to do the recording.<BR><BR>Does anyone know how to do this?<BR><BR>Mike Edwards<BR><BR></DIV></DIV></DIV></BLOCKQUOTE></td></tr></table><br>
